channel.title: Fast flash stick?
channel.description:
So for my web authoring module at uni we need to set up xampp on a usb flash drive. The teacher told us we all need to buy the fastest one we could find. I thought I'd stick with my current one. Turns out the best speeds I can get is about 3mb/s which seems pretty poor considering when I tried to delete a 200mb file it gave me an estimated time of 40 minutes. When I looked around some retail websites (ebuyer/scan/novatech) I could only see the speeds advertised at something like 300mb/s read and write which seems a bit much.
So how can I find a stick that doesn't suck?

item.title: Fast flash stick?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“chri5, post:13, topic:363703”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=459947.msg3385530#msg3385530 date=1288419615]
^ Including the user

My mom needs help uploading her files from a flash drive =/
[/quote]
Does that really effect the performance of the drive?[/quote]Not in the system, no. But if can definitely change how effectively the drive is used, and how quickly you get what you want done.

Read full topic

item.title: Fast flash stick?
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Mopman:

fast usb sticks are hardly trivial

Yah but all the websites I was looking at weren’t giving me read/write speeds that sounded plausible (something like 200mb write or something). I went with this one in the end:

http://www.ebuyer.com/product/140337

and portable xampp now works! Time to make some shitty html

Read full topic

item.title: Fast flash stick?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Man UTD Freak:

Are USB 3.0 sticks available at the moment although their cost is considerably higher?

A faster interface still won’t help you if the flash chips are slow. A storage device is only as fast as it’s slowest component.

Read full topic

item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“thepinksock, post:5, topic:363703”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=459947.msg3366182#msg3366182 date=1286812436]

So for my web authoring module at uni we need to set up xampp on a usb flash drive. The teacher told us we all need to buy the fastest one we could find. I thought I’d stick with my current one. Turns out the best speeds I can get is about 3mb/s which seems pretty poor considering when I tried to delete a 200mb file it gave me an estimated time of 40 minutes. When I looked around some retail websites (ebuyer/scan/novatech) I could only see the speeds advertised at something like 300mb/s read and write which seems a bit much.

So how can I find a stick that doesn’t suck?
[/quote]Wow, they force u to buy that out of ur own pockets? That’s retarded

Yep, have to pay for tuition at uni and also have to pay for the textbooks (one of susies is £300)

or you can just not buy the books, apparently for my subject they aren’t vital, so I’m going to spend the money on alcohol instead[/quote]They give out free computer science usb sticks at my uni

Read full topic
